title: Drawing, "The Three Graces", ca. 1813
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, black chalk over traces of graphite on cream laid paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Three Graces and two cupids. Typical pose of Three Graces which shows two sporting veil, while central Grace shown with wreath. At left and at right, putti playing cymbals. On verso: graphite sketch of similar compartment. In center, woman sitting on pedestal. She is turned towards left and extends a thread supported by left hand of dancing girl, raising wreath.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "The Three Graces", ca. 1813.
ca. 1813. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, black chalk over traces of graphite on cream laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-1670.
